Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
```
    kmdinfo=$(jq -cr '. | {blocks, connections, balance}' <<<$(komodo-cli getinfo))
    kmdlastntrztime=$(jq -r '[.[] | select((.address != null) and (.time != null) and (.address = "$kmdntrzaddr"))] | sort_by(.time) | last | (.time)' <<<$(komodo-cli listtransactions "" $txscanamount))
    printf "$format\n" "KMD" " " \
            "$(jq "[.[] | select(.amount==($utxoamt|tonumber))] | length" <<<$(komodo-cli listunspent))" \
            "$(jq .blocks <<<"${kmdinfo}")" \
            "$(printf "%12.4f" $(jq .balance <<<"${kmdinfo}"))" \
            "$(timeSince $kmdlastntrztime)" \
            "$(jq .connections <<<"${kmdinfo}")"```
because I was bored and woke up at midnight 30

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: What's the stdout say at the time of the connect inputs failed?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The fact the errors go to 2 diff places is something we may need to try and fix long term, but its not so easy

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also if dh is doing oracles its possible its trying to double spend

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I need to do some more investigation but my understanding of how CCS work, means that they can spend inputs out of order...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: When spamming migrates, you will find that the stdout will spam momom-check-fail ... And the debug.log spams connect inputs failed... They r the same error, and mean nothing in that case, justeans u tried to import before the notarizations happened... Its because of the sledgehammer code.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: When u spam a lot of oracles, they make txns that depend on your local mempool, and the way the mempool works, means that txns will try to propagate to other nodes that don't yet have the inputs they need to be valid.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Once these txns are included in a block, they are put in every nodes mempool, so they can be validated out of order. I think its because making the miner need to place all txns in the block in the correct order is either too slow or too hard.
